lines.text: [last lines]

It is right and proper, and a part of my duty which I shall gladly discharge, to recognise to the full the courage, devotion and sacrifice of each of these men. I should not like to leave this case without thanking everybody concerned for having given me the best working day of my life, in listening to the very modest recital of some gallant gentlemen concerning a memorable achievement.
[Looking at deck gun]
A gun is like a woman. You can't tell what it's like until you're in action. Then it's too late.
That's no plane. That's bloody Jupiter.
lines.character: On Board M.V. San Demetrio: Apprentice John Jones

lines.text:
[proposing a toast]
I looks towards you.
I catches your eye.
I bows according.
Down the hatch.
What's the matter chum? Ain't you 'ungry?
I've left me teeth on board.
Never mind - I'll lend you mine when I've finished.
I look at it this way. We set out to take this petrol to England and we've got it half way already. Doesn't seem sense in turning it round and taking it back again
Mr Hawkins, As senior deck officer, you're in charge of this boat. If you want advice about anything, you're welcome, but don't think you have to ask me. I can take orders as well as give 'em.

[refusing help from a tug]
We've done more than a thousand miles on our own. I think we can manage the rest.
First stop England!
First stop Wales...
lines.character: On Board M.V. San Demetrio: Apprentice John Jones

lines.text: First stop Scotland. It's the Clyde we're bound for.
You're all getting mighty particular. There's a hell of a lump of land ahead of us there somewhere.
Good job too. If we fetch up anywhere between Narvik and Gibraltar we'll be lucky.
They're singing alright. Here we are rolling about in a gale in the middle of the Atlantic, U-boats all around, no escort, and as far as the British are concerned it still seems to be Saturday night.
